TopicTitle: Has anyone explored KSC on foot?

Articles.Content: Has anyone walked around the KSC and found anything interesting?
There's the Mk1 pod statue and you can climb on the flagpole, but mainly people use the buildings for MLG stunts with planes.
I've explored by Rover and then walking about back in the previous version. Buildings have climbable ladders/stairs, the pod statue, and little else that I saw at least...

Cool, pro, rad, incredible and the like.

Sorry for the internet slang.

With 1.0 and the ability for Kerbals to climb ledges, get ready for some EXTREME PARKOUR!!1!!!1one

Edited January 30, 2015 by Janos1986
There is a partially buried Monolith nearby.

Plenty of people have. More I think will have taken a drive round, since the Space Centre isn't small and Kerbals aren't quick walkers. There are assorted stairs and ladders to climb, and a few points of special interest around.

There are also a few neat things to find once the buildings have been destroyed.
I climbed to the top of every last tier building possible and found some cabnits on top of the vab (metal) maybe a fuse box or ventalation system?

I have not walked around the KSC itself too much, although I did once walk to the other coast of the KSC continent. Corbus Kerman ran for several days almost without stopping, but the views from the central mountains were pretty neat.
Walking takes too long. Do it in style...

I walked a lot.

climed both flag poles

I had the coolest idea for people who use KAS. And by coolest I mean everyone probably already tried it.

1) Grab a radial chute

2) climb on top of the VAB or anything high enough and climbable

3) BASEJUMP

Edited February 1, 2015 by Janos1986

I like to fly around it in small maneuverable planes/gliders, it's good fun to swoop around. Also it's an ideal testing ground for rovers/buggies, since there's plenty of sharp turns and different slopes. I also just take some kerbals for a joyride around the place for fun and to look around, they put quite a lot of detail into the place, if you really take the time to look around.

I had the coolest idea for people who use KAS. And by coolest I mean everyone probably already tried it.

1) Grab a radial chute

2) climb on top of the VAB or anything high enough and climbable

3) BASEJUMP

Jeb tried doing that from one of the Mun arches.

...it did not end well.

Edited February 1, 2015 by Panzerbeard
